oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newspaper, Forney's War Press
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Original newspaper, Forney's War Press, August 20, 1863. This woodcut shows "Rebel Citizens attacking Sutler En Route For the Army." Forney's was a weekly newspaper published in Philadelphia (Pa." It was dedicated to covering news of the Civil War.; The publisher, John Forney, was secretary of the US Senate during Lincoln's administration. After the war, the paper returned to general news and its pre-war title, Weekly Press. Forney sold the paper in the 1870s. It ceased publication around 1880.
